body.p:
156
Oct 17th 3
Brig. Gen S. S. Fry.
Comm'd'g Camp Nelson -- Ky.
General,

Your letter to the Governor of the 14th inst. has been referred to this office. It relates to the Adjutantcy of the 49th Ky. Vols. Infantry. I find on looking over our files, that on the 13th of Sept. your recommended Lieut. H. B. Stanwood for promotion to some position in a new Regt. in a letter to the Governor, of that date. The latter at once, to show his appreciation of your recommendation personally directed Stanwood's appointment to the only position within his gift, which was then vacant.

I recite this, so you may understand the manner in which he received the commission. If Stanwood will decline the commission, and retain his old position -- his claims to someother vacancy will be cosnidered -- there is no other way to put the young man you mention in -- except by appointing him in the line -- on Colonel's recommendation -- and then making him Adjutant, while Stanwood takes his place in the Company.

Respectfully
Your obt serv't
John Boyle
Adjt. Gen of Ky
